channel.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
channel.description:
well lately my computer has been lagging on games i was able to play before...
heres a FPS Log update per >5 [code]60 55 60 55 60 55 60 55 **about 5 minutes later** 9 5 9 5 0 5 0 50 60 60 55 60 55[/code]
AMD Athlon II P340 Dual Core 2.20GHZ 64bit 6.00GB ram (5.74 GB usable) service pack 1 Windows 7 Home Premium
Rating: 5.5/7.9
what causes the random FPS lag spikes and how can i fix it?
Answers i do not want to hear "Get a better computer" "buy better hardware" or anything simular wallet = 0;

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

You could always just blow into it really hard the effectiveness really depends on the structure of the airflow in the case though

Read full topic

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:17, topic:478917”][quote author=mironic link=topic=597135.msg4205059#msg4205059 date=1358810325]
yeah… i need to wait before i clean it… my HP are assholes and put a Bottom lock on it…

i cant get it apart so i have to buy the stupid compressor. lol
[/quote]
If it’s still under warranty ask them to do it, compressed air isn’t really as effective[/quote]

you want me to ship my Computer to their factory… and wait 6 weeks for them to send it back dust free?
6 weeks D:… no thanks. il just use compressed air and a vaccuum

Read full topic

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

My laptop has the exact same specs, from acer. It definitely overheats from gaming. My old xp desktop amd 2800 with a 256mb nvidia graphics card used to handle gaming better.

Read full topic
item.source: Perhaps you guys can help me?

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Give her a clean then, I had this with my laptop quite a lot, being 3 years old and playing Battlefield 3 it would overheat a fair bit. Best off taking it apart, or if you’re not confident in doing so, get a high pressure air tank and shoot that into the intake, I happened to have one lying around and my brother used it with his, reduced temps by 20~ degrees.

Read full topic
item.source: Perhaps you guys can help me?

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:12, topic:478917”]Yes hi moronic mironic sorry

Is the fps log in the OP an actual log or something you just typed up from estimation? If that’s actual then it’s definitely overheating. And yeah speedfan is not always accurate at measuring fan speeds on laptops, but it’s very reliable for the temperatures themselves.[/quote]
yes thats vindictus’s Fps log.

Read full topic
item.source: Perhaps you guys can help me?

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Yes hi moronic mironic sorry

Is the fps log in the OP an actual log or something you just typed up from estimation? If that’s actual then it’s definitely overheating. And yeah speedfan is not always accurate at measuring fan speeds on laptops, but it’s very reliable for the temperatures themselves.

Read full topic
item.source: Perhaps you guys can help me?

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:10, topic:478917”][quote author=mironic link=topic=597135.msg4204944#msg4204944 date=1358796940]

I don’t see how you can play Skyrim fine on max settings. I have the same integrated chip with a Phenom 3.6ghz Quad Core, and on medium I only get around 20-23 fps. Even with my GTX 560ti I only get around 45 to 50. Although Source games on medium work fine. I love Counter-Strike and it played decently, for an integrated GPU.

old source games work fine, its the ones that recently update (except portal)

Like vindictus, Gmod and tf2
[/quote]

Oh I was talking about CS:GO. Lovely game.[/quote]
lol, wierd thing is it only lags while its on multiplayer mode… singleplayer does’nt lag.

Read full topic

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:6, topic:478917”]Looks like possible overheating or CPU bottleneck, try run the games windowed and use a program like speedfan to monitor temperatures and usage. If it’s constantly running at 95%+ usage it’s a CPU bottleneck.

Is it a laptop by any chance?[/quote]
yes, laptop.

((also haaai CJ :D))

edit: speedfan says my fan is 0RPM. but i hear it and feel it working… so so idk

my usage in games is only 50%

Read full topic
item.source: Perhaps you guys can help me?

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Looks like possible overheating or CPU bottleneck, try run the games windowed and use a program like speedfan to monitor temperatures and usage. If it’s constantly running at 95%+ usage it’s a CPU bottleneck.

Is it a laptop by any chance?

Read full topic
item.source: Perhaps you guys can help me?

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:4, topic:478917”]That’s an onboard card, and really not good for gaming! I have the same one, and I can barely play minecraft.

But you said you used to play them fine. So I’m at a loss, just thought I’d suggest some common troubles[/quote]
any fixes or tweaks? because this only happens in source games… i can play skyrim without lag on highest detail lol. then a simple low detail source game starts lagging in multiplayer.

i dont even

Read full topic

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

That’s an onboard card, and really not good for gaming! I have the same one, and I can barely play minecraft.

But you said you used to play them fine. So I’m at a loss, just thought I’d suggest some common troubles

item.title: Perhaps you guys can help me?
item.dc:creator: @mironic mironic
item.description:
@mironic wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:2, topic:478917”]What kind of graphics card is it? And did you try updating or reinstalling the drivers?

It could also be possible that you have malware.[/quote]
i have tried Uninstalling/reinstaling and disabling sound.

I scanned with my antivirus panda and anti-malware and they both came up with nothing.

its a
AMD M880G with ATI Mobility Radeon HD 4250 Video Card

also it only seems to Spike juring multiplayer on source games.

edit: sees you go offline right after asking a question ┻━┻ ︵ヽ(`Д´)ﾉ︵﻿ ┻━┻

Read full topic
